revised_title: Evolution of Sedimentary Basins: Faulting and Graben Formation in Western and Central Europe
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of sedimentary basins and graben formation in western and central Europe. It explores the different mechanisms that governed the development of these basins, including crustal extension, wrench-induced pull-apart features, and compression. The article also highlights the role of tensional and compressional tectonics in the formation of these basins and the impact of orogenic cycles on their development.
